verbs.description: elix (third-person singular simple present elixes, present participle elixing, simple past and past participle elixed)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To draw out or extract.
examples: O that our muse / Had those abstruse and sinewy faculties / That with a strain of fresh invention / She might press out the rarity of art, / The pur'st elixed juice of rich conceit, / In your attentive ears, that with the lip / Of gracious elocution we might drink / A sound carouse unto your health of wit.
